class UIElementDocs:
    logger_level = """
    'critical': "Use this level for very serious errors that may prevent the program from running."
    
    'error': "Use this level for serious errors. The program may still run, but there could be issues."
    
    'warning': "Use this level to indicate potential problems that could occur in the future, or to log unexpected events."
    
    'info': "Use this level for general system information. Useful to confirm that things are operating as expected."
    
    'debug': "Use this level for detailed information useful in diagnosing problems. This level logs output from all steps of a program's execution."
    
    'notset': "This is a default logger level before a specific level is set. When used in logging, it behaves like the root logger."
    """

    use_external_execute = """
     This advanced feature enables you to utilize external machines, either through a render farm or by running advanced code.
     """

    file_pattern_knob = """
    Custom Filename and Path Configuration

    Configure the naming convention for your output files and folders by using a customizable format string. 
    The default format is:
        <span style='color:blue'>&lt;scriptName&gt;/&lt;nodeName&gt;/%Y%m%d/%Y%m%d_%H%M%S</span>
    This format will generate directories and filenames based on the current script name, node name, and timestamp. 

    You can adjust this format to meet your needs. Here's how:

    \t<b>1 - <span style='color:green'>&lt;scriptName&gt;</span>:</b> Will be replaced with the name of your current Nuke script. If the script is unsaved, "untitled" will be used.
    \t<b>2 - <span style='color:green'>&lt;nodeName&gt;</span>:</b> Will be replaced with the name of the current node.
    \t<b>3 - <span style='color:green'>Date and Time Formatting:</span></b> Use standard Python strftime codes to format the current date and time. 
    \t    For example, <span style='color:blue'>%Y</span> for the full year, <span style='color:blue'>%m</span> for the month, <span style='color:blue'>%d</span> for the day, <span style='color:blue'>%H</span> for hours, <span style='color:blue'>%M</span> for minutes, and <span style='color:blue'>%S</span> for seconds.
    \t<b>4 -</b> Separate sections with <span style='color:blue'>/</span> to create a directory structure in the generated path. 

    Customize the format to organize your outputs into folders by date, script, or node, and append a unique timestamp to filenames to avoid overwrites.
    """

    execute_btn = """
    Press this button to generate the image. Once the button is pressed a process is launched on the Nuke's terminal. You can look there to see the progress or errors.
    """

    interrupt_btn = """
    Interrupts the current launched process.
    """

    save_settings_btn = """
    Saves the current settings to the current user directory
    """

    load_settings_btn = """
    Retrieves the latest saved settings from the current user directory
    """

    pre_cmd_knob = """
    Terminal command to be executed before the stable diffusion process starts
    """

    post_cmd_knob = """
    Terminal command to be executed after the stable diffusion process has been completed.
    """

    logger_level_menu = """
    'critical': "Use this level for very serious errors that may prevent the program from running."
    
    'error': "Use this level for serious errors. The program may still run, but there could be issues."
    
    'warning': "Use this level to indicate potential problems that could occur in the future, or to log unexpected events."
    
    'info': "Use this level for general system information. Useful to confirm that things are operating as expected."
    
    'debug': "Use this level for detailed information useful in diagnosing problems. This level logs output from all steps of a program's execution."
    
    'notset': "This is a default logger level before a specific level is set. When used in logging, it behaves like the root logger."
    """

    time_out = """
    Time out in milliseconds for the process to wait in order to consider there's an error.
    """

    output_dir = """
    Directory where the generated images will be stored in PNG format. Located in the local user folder by default.
    """

    cache_dir = """
    Directory where the cache for the generated images will be stored.
    """

    python_path_knob = """
    Path to the python runtime directory
    """

    live_update_knob = """Enable this to update the node when moving to a frame that hasn't been rendered yet."""

    batch_process_knob = """Starts a batch process for the range of frames. This will send updated data for each frame to the server."""

    time_out = """
    This knob sets the maximum time, in milliseconds, that the client will wait for a response from the server for each frame. 
    If the server does not respond within this time, the process will return None.
    When running a batch process, the total waiting time will be this value multiplied by the number of frames in the batch.
    """



[docs]
    @classmethod
    def get_doc(cls, ui_name):
        if hasattr(cls, ui_name):
            return getattr(cls, ui_name).replace('    ', '')
        return ''
